xocs:funding-list.xocs:funding-text: We would like to thank the anonymous referee's valuable comments and suggestions. This work does not have any conflicts of interest. This paper is supported by the National Natural Science Foundation of China grant 12071021.

affiliation.ce:source-text: Department of Mathematics, Beijing Jiaotong University, Beijing, China

head.citation-title: Uncertainty principles for the two-sided offset quaternion linear canonical transform
head.abstracts: Â© 2021 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd.The offset quaternion linear canonical transform (OQLCT) provides a more general framework for a number of linear integral transforms in signal processing and optics, such as quaternion Fourier transform (QFT), fractional quaternion Fourier transform (FrQFT), and linear canonical transform (QLCT). We devote this paper to various different of uncertainty principles (UPs) for the two-sided OQLCT, which including logarithmic UP, Heisenberg-type UP, Hardy's UP, Beurling's UP, Entropic UP, Donoho-Stark's UP, and Local UP. Moreover, we also prove Lieb's UP for the two-sided short-time offset quaternion linear canonical transform (SOQLCT).

affiliation.ce:source-text: Department of Mathematics, Beijing Jiaotong University, Beijing, China

author-keyword.$: short-time offset quaternion linear canonical transform (SOQLCT)

We devote this paper to various different of uncertainty principles (UPs) for the two-sided OQLCT, which including logarithmic UP, Heisenberg-type UP, Hardy's UP, Beurling's UP, Entropic UP, Donoho-Stark's UP, and Local UP. Moreover, we also prove Lieb's UP for the two-sided short-time offset quaternion linear canonical transform (SOQLCT).
